intro: Pedicularis chorgonica, commonly known as the Chorgon lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family, which includes various parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant typically grows at high altitudes, often in alpine meadows and rocky habitats. Its flowers are usually red or orange, with a distinctive bilabiate structure, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its specialized habitat, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
